articles.description: Owen Farrell will replace George Ford at fly-half for England's Rugby World Cup quarter-final against Fiji, with Marcus Smith starting at full-back.
articles.title: Farrell replaces Ford for England's quarter-final

articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as New Zealand play Bangladesh in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: New Zealand v Bangladesh - clips, radio & text

articles.description: Reaction as Scotland lose to Spain in Euro 2024 qualifying, plus build-up to England v Australia friendly and all the latest football news.
articles.title: Reaction to Scotland defeat & build-up to England v Australia

articles.description: France captain Antoine Dupont will start at scrum-half in their Rugby World Cup quarter-final against South Africa in Paris on Sunday.
articles.title: France pick fit-again Dupont to face Springboks

articles.description: How confusion reigned in Spain as Scott McTominay's wonder goal was ruled out and Scotland's winning run in Euro 2024 qualifying was halted.
articles.title: 'Referee changed his mind' - Scots rue VAR chaos

articles.description: Gareth Southgate's England squad has been described as the 'Golden Generation', but is it really better than 2004? Have your say.
articles.title: England's new Golden Generation? Or is 2004 vintage still ahead?

articles.description: New Zealand bowler Trent Boult dismisses Bangladesh batter Liton Das with the first ball of their Cricket World Cup match in Chennai.
articles.title: 'What a start!' - NZ's Boult takes wicket with first ball

articles.description: Ireland are well equipped to deal with the weight of history and break new ground in the World Cup, writes former Irish wing Tommy Bowe.
articles.title: 'Ireland's best chance to reach World Cup semi-final'

articles.description: Roberto di Maio says he hopes to "inspire people" after making his San Marino debut at the age of 40.
articles.title: 'What on earth are you doing?' - San Marino debutant at 40

articles.description: The Belgian Grand Prix at Spa-Francorchamps will remain on the Formula 1 calendar at least until 2025 after a new contract was signed.
articles.title: Belgian GP stays on calendar until at least 2025
